generif.text: Induction of human vaspin mRNA expression in adipose tissue is regulated in a fat depot-specific manner and could be associated with parameters of obesity, insulin resistance, and glucose metabolism.
Low circulating vaspin correlates with a high fitness level, whereas physical training in untrained individuals causes increased vaspin serum concentrations.
Elevated serum and omental adipose tissue levels of vaspin in overweight polycystic ovary syndrome women and ex vivo regulation of vaspin expression.
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)
results demonstrate a significant association of vaspin SNP rs2236242 with T2DM in the KORA F3 study with the AA genotype bearing an increased risk (adjusted OR 2.35 [1.59; 3.46] versus AT/TT).
may be the compensatory molecule in the pathogenesis of metabolic syndrome. (review)

Low vaspin serum concentrations correlate with recently experienced ischemic events in patients with carotid stenosis despite the lack of an association between circulating vaspin and parameters of atherosclerosis severity.
Serum vaspin concentrations in premenopausal women are not affected by polycystic ovary syndrome, obesity, or glucose tolerance disorders.
Higher vaspin(SERPINA12) and lower adiponectin levels in obese children: these adipokines are significantly correlated with insulin sensitivity indices in this age.
Vaspin is expressed in the human placenta and is regulated by nutrtional status.
the first study to show that high body fatness along with low CRF might contribute to increased vaspin concentrations in Korean young men.
Observational study of gene-disease association. (HuGE Navigator)

Serum vaspin level is higher in diabetic patients than that in NGT subjects in women. Age predicts serum vaspin level in NGT subjects, while PG2h is independently associated with vaspin in diabetic patients.
Our results support the existence of a sexual dimorphism regarding circulating vaspin but find no major role for vaspin concerning insulin sensitivity in nondiabetic humans.
Serum vaspin level is one of the predictors for insulin resistance
Circulating vaspin levels are not significantly different between gestational diabetes mellitus, preeclampsia, and control subjects and do not correlate with insulin sensitivity in pregnant subjects
visceral adipose tissue area was independently correlated with serum vaspin concentrations in the higher insulin resistance group
Vaspin serum concentrations are altered in patients with non-alcoholic fatty liver disease.
Serum vaspin levels have a meal-related diurnal variation, suggesting a role for vaspin in metabolic regulation
Clinical trial of gene-disease association and gene-environment interaction. (HuGE Navigator)
lower maternal vaspin concentrations in cases of vaginal delivery may be attributed to spontaneous term delivery inflammation
Serum vaspin levels are raised in patients with nonalcoholic fatty liver disease regardless of potential confounders and represent an independent predictor of liver fibrosis scores
both vaspin and visfatin/Nampt might play an important role in the pathogenesis of T2DM.
Presence of increased vaspin and higher insulin resistance values in women with polycystic ovary syndrome could contribute to increased diabetogenic and atherogenic risk in these patients.
Observational study of gene-disease association, gene-environment interaction, and pharmacogenomic / toxicogenomic. (HuGE Navigator)
Decreased vaspin and increased visfatin serum levels were observed in asymptomatic patients with coronary artery disease.
Vaspin serum concentrations are decreased by exercise-induced oxidative stress, but not by exercise-associated improvement in insulin sensitivity.
Letter: serum vaspin levels were not significantly different in patients with Kawasaki disease compared to controls.
there is a complex interplay between epicardial fat thickness, serum vaspin, and liver histology in promoting an impaired hyperemic stimulation of coronary blood flow in patients with NAFLD
Higher plasma vaspin concentrations are significantly associated with metabolic syndrome in men. In women, vaspin concentrations are associated with coronary atherosclerosis.
Vaspin expression in abdominal adipose tissue was adipocyte-specific and vaspin expression in subcutaneous adipose tissue decreased as visceral adipose tissue area increased.
Data indicating a possible role of leptin, adiponectin, visfatin, chemerin and vaspin in the pathogenesis of chronic hepatitis are summarized.
We herein present novel data indicating SERPINA12 levels are neither altered in overt and subclinical hypothyroidism
The present study indicates that vaspin protects vascular endothelial cells from FFA-induced apoptosis through upregulation of the PI3-kinase/Akt signaling pathway.

Our study is the first report on the new adipokines vaspin and omentin in patients with JIA, and it shows that omentin is significantly higher in juvenile idiopathic arthritis patients in comparison with healthy controls.
circulating vaspin levels have an effect on metabolic variables in elderly twins
Serum vaspin concentration seems to reflect intensity of liver angiogenesis in chronic hepatitis C patients.

The anti-inflammatory adipokine vaspin is discussed as a new link between inflammation and obesity. We demonstrate that - different from healthy controls - vaspin serum levels in patients with psoriasis were body mass index independent.
Serum vaspin levels were related to insulin resistance, and higher levels of serum vaspin in 7% of the Japanese population are closely linked to minor allele sequence (A) of rs77060950.
Variability in serum vaspin concentrations might be explained by its genetic variants.

Finding showed that there are significant differences in genotype frequencies between the groups regarding vaspin rs2236242 polymorphism (chi(2)=18.74, p<0.0001). A significant protection against Metabolic syndrome was found for vaspin rs2236242 in allele and genotypes
Serum vaspin cannot independently predict gestational diabetes mellitus and it is not affected by the degree of glucose metabolism deregulation or the exogenous administration of insulin.
Variants of the vaspin gene are associated with serum vaspin levels and with the risk for coronary artery disease in the Chinese population.
Vaspin inhibited the apoptosis of human osteoblasts through ERK signaling pathway.
common and rare variants in FTO, SERPINA12, and ITGAL predict PON1 acti
A significant inverse association was found, in patients with type 2 diabetes mellitus, between serum vaspin concentration and the presence of carotid plaque.
Creatinine levels correlate hegatively with serum vaspin levels and are significantly reduced in Japanese patients with hemodialyais therapy in the low vaspin group.
metformin therapy reduces vaspin concentration in a gender-specific manner. Metformin exerts little benefit in increasing adiponectin levels in diabetes patients.

Vaspin is a novel ligand for the cell-surface GRP78/voltage-dependent anion channel complex in endothelial cells and promotes proliferation, inhibits apoptosis, and protects vascular injuries in diabetes mellitus.

Cross-sectional data on South Korean 9-year-olds suggest that overweight boys and girls have higher vaspin and leptin serum levels than boys and girls of normal weight, whereas only overweight boys have higher visfatin levels than normal weight boys.
data suggest that serum vaspin concentrations might modulate human eating behaviour
Our study showed that the serum vaspin level is decreased in chronic hepatitis C patients with non-advanced fibrosis
Vaspin treatment of isolated pancreatic islets leads to increased insulin concentration in the media upon glucose stimulation without influencing insulin secretion.
Insulin administration down-regulates serum vaspin levels.

The observed higher levels of omentin-1, visfatin, and vaspin in patients with colorectal cancer (CRC), independent of measures of obesity, suggest that these adipocytokines may have a potential role in the development of CRC.
possible alterations in cord blood levels of insulin and the adipokines vaspin and omentin-1 were investigated in large-for-gestational age and appropriate-for-gestational age infants.
Vaspin levels have been shown to increase in acute ischemic stroke patients. The increased vaspin levels may vary depending on several factors in acute period of ischemic stroke.

A rare variant (rs61757459) in vaspin coding for the stop codon p.R211X is related to lower circulating vaspin (SERPINA12) concentrations. Structure analysis suggests misfolding and instability due to the absence of core structural domains.
The plasma vaspin concentrations correlate with the severity of coronary artery disease.
Low levels of circulating adiponectin and vaspin levels are associated with an increased risk of developing endometrial cancer.
vaspin is an adipokine that may have a role in metabolic syndrome in males
Serum vaspin concentrations are elevated in patients with ulcerative colitis.
the correlations of visfatin/Nampt, vaspin, and RBP-4 with insulin resistance are tissue dependent.
serum vaspin level was positively associated with c-IMT, independently of insulin resistance in a general population.
Vaspin rs2236242 gene polymorphism is associated with polycystic ovary syndrome risk.

The expression of human vaspin (serpinA12) is positively correlated to body mass index and insulin sensitivity and increases glucose tolerance in vivo, suggesting a compensatory role in response to diminished insulin signaling in obesity.
during pregnancy, high vaspin concentration is significantly associated with insulin resistance in gestational diabetes mellitus
Serum vaspin levels showed no significant difference between the type 2 diabetics with renal insufficiency and without renal insufficiency.
Higher vaspin levels are associated with obesity and type 2 diabetes mellitus.
These findings suggest that vaspin and VAP-1 may play a role in the pathogenesis of psoriasis and can be used as markers of the disease; vaspin levels may reflect the severity of disease.
vaspin is a beneficial adipokine in obesity
High levels of serum vaspin is associated with obesity.
In the sepsis group, vaspin plasma concentration was about three-fold as high as in the median surgical control group.
vaspin can play a role as a new marker in the diagnosis, severity assessment, and prognosis of subarachnoid hemorrhage
Mean vaspin and apelin levels were significantly lower in underweight children compared to controls
It is believed that vaspin could be regarded as a new link between obesity and related metabolic disorders, including glucose intolerance.

Circulating vaspin level is higher in women than in men in obese individuals. Vaspin had mediator effect between visceral fat and fat mass associations with resting metabolic rate in obese participants.
structural and functional results reveal the mechanistic basis of how reactive centre loop sequence and exosite interaction in vaspin enable KLK7 recognition and regulate protease inhibition
Low vaspin blood levels in patients with prolactinomas.
serum visceral adipose tissue-derived serpin (vaspin) levels in patients with normal glucose regulation and recently diagnosed type 2 diabetes, was investigated.
The minor allele of vaspin rs2236242 polymorphism plays a protective role against metabolic syndrome.
The development of clinically manifest arthritis after follow-up was associated with baseline serum vaspin levels.
High serum vaspin concentrations are associated with Obese type 2 diabetes mellitus.
In COPD, the meta-analysis of % predicted FEV1 in cases, the strongest association was shown for a splice variant in a previously unreported region, SERPINA12 (rs140198372, pmeta=5.72x10(-6)).
High serum vaspin levels are associated with coronary artery disease in patients with type 2 diabetes.

In patients with diabetic nephropathy (DNP), vaspin level does not change within the early stages of DNP; while it is higher in patients with decreased glomerular filtration rate, which may be related with increasing inflammation regardless of the stage of the kidney disease.
There was no difference in serum chemerin, vaspin and omentin-1 between polycystic ovary syndrome patients and healthy controls.

Vaspin might be a useful predictive biomarker in patients with AMI, and patients with low vaspin levels might have a high risk of a MACE. In addition, vaspin might have protective effects on the improvement of LVEF after AMI.
omentin, as compared to vaspin, seems to provide a better predictor of insulin resistance in obese individuals.
Circulating vaspin levels were lower in nonalcoholic fatty liver disease.
Vaspin was associated with a reduced risk of insulin resistance independently of BMI and pubertal stage and the association was influenced by body fat and physical activity in these adolescents.

vaspin could be visibly observed within the detectable concentrations of vaspin up to 5nM in both buffer and serum conditions. The sensitivity of this LFSA developed in this study was ranged from 0.137 to 25nM in buffer and from 0.105 to 25nM in spiked human serum, respectively. T

Together, these data show that vaspin binds heparin with high affinity (KD = 21 +/- 2 nm) and that binding takes place at a basic patch on top of beta-sheet A and is different from other heparin-binding serpins.
vaspin rs2236242 polymorphism is not associated with metabolic syndrome in Egyptian women

Vaspin acts as a coordinator of the dynamic balance between bone formation and resorption processes; its action is affected by the cytokines of the RANKL/RANK/OPG system. Changes in the relationships between vaspin, bone markers, OPG, and RANKL might contribute to the development of osteoporosis in girls with anorexia nervosa.
Suggest vaspin could be involved in the pathophysiology of cirrhosis, but is not a good indicator of its origin or severity and does not impact the thrombotic activity of platelets.

The minor A allele of vaspin rs2236242 polymorphism plays a protective role against obesity and diabetes among women in Upper Egypt.  The serum vaspin concentration was lower in minor protective allele carriers.
Serum vaspin cannot be used as an independent marker for the presence of coronary artery disease in the general population.
Vaspin may play an important compensatory role in obesity and insulin resistance in elderly people.
High vaspin expression is associated with osteoporosis and arterial stiffness.

Vaspin is modified at all 3 predicted asparagine glycosylation sites near the reactive center loop. Biochemical data demonstrate that glycosylation does not hinder inhibition of the target protease kallikrein 7. Although binding affinity to heparin is slightly decreased, the protease inhibition reaction is still significantly accelerated in the presence of heparin. Glycosylation did not affect thermal stability.

Study provides evidence that serum vaspin level could be regarded as the predictor for improvement of fatty liver and metabolic disturbance after laparoscopic vertical banded gastroplasty surgery in patients with severe obesity.
anti-inflammatory effects of vaspin in 3T3-L1 adipocytes as well as increased insulin signaling by endogenous expression or exogenous treatment, are reported.
Serum vaspin level may be a useful marker for the prediction of ovulation induction success in treatment with clomiphene citrate
subcutaneous adipose tissue and liver fat content were identified as predominant sites associated with leptin and vaspin levels, respectively

The aims of this study were to evaluate and correlate circulating chemerin, apelin, vaspin, and omentin-1 levels in obese type 2 diabetic Egyptian patients with coronary artery stenosis (CAS), and to assess their usefulness as noninvasive diagnostic biomarkers.

Studied the effects of vaspin on lipopolysaccharide (LPS)induced acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS) in vivo and in vitro, and further explored the molecular basis and potential mechanisms underlying these effects.  It was demonstrated that vaspin protects against LPSinduced ARDS through reversing EC barrier dysfunction via the suppression of inflammation, apoptosis and ROS generation in pulmonary ECs.
Serum vaspin concentrations were significantly higher in the type-2 diabetes mellitus (T2DM) group than in the T2DM + macrovascular complications group.

The vaspin represents a multi-specific serpin targeting the kallikrein proteases KLK7 and KLK14, with distinct exosites regulating recognition of these target proteases and opposing effects of heparin binding on the inhibition reaction.
vaspin decreased miR-33a levels, which in turn increased ABCA1 expression and cholesteorl efflux.
Elevated levels of vaspin were associated with 1.7 times increased cardiovascular disease risk.

In this study, we report a cognate pair of the aptamer-based sandwich-type electrochemical biosensor for type 2 diabetes biomarker (Vaspin) using coccolith modified electrodeposited on the screen-printed gold electrode (CME-SPGE)
Vaspin can play a specific role in the pathogenesis of metabolic disorders in these subjects and can be a specific indicator substance in BD.
Higher serum vaspin levels were seen in gestational diabetic females, but genotype and allele frequencies showed no association of vaspin with gestational diabetes mellitus.
vaspin as potential novel biomarker for the prediction and early diagnosis of Gestational Diabetes Mellitus.

BP.term: positive regulation of insulin receptor signaling pathway
negative regulation of lipid biosynthetic process
positive regulation of phosphatidylinositol 3-kinase/protein kinase B signal transduction

name: serpin family A member 12
other_names: serine (or cysteine) proteinase inhibitor, clade A (alpha-1 antiproteinase, antitrypsin), member 12
serpin peptidase inhibitor, clade A (alpha-1 antiproteinase, antitrypsin), member 12
visceral adipose tissue-derived serine protease inhibitor
summary: Predicted to enable serine-type endopeptidase inhibitor activity. Predicted to be involved in negative regulation of endopeptidase activity. Predicted to act upstream of or within negative regulation of gluconeogenesis; positive regulation of signal transduction; and regulation of lipid metabolic process. Predicted to be located in plasma membrane. Predicted to be active in extracellular space. [provided by Alliance of Genome Resources, Apr 2022]
